trial_identification.studytitle: Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) Constitution in patients with obstructive sleep apnea syndrome (OSAS) treated with continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP).
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Among patients with obstructive sleep apnea syndrome, is the treatment with continuous positive airway pressure improving constitution in Traditional Chinese Medicine?

interventions.interventions: nasal continuous positive airway pressure (nCPAP), participant will wear it during sleeping at least 4 hours per night and lasted for twelve weeks. Initial pressure of CPAP is set between 4-20 cm H2O, and will be adjusted in a 4-week interval according to participant's response.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) constitution, as assessed by Constitution in Chinese Medicine Questionnaire (CCMQ), and answered by participants
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline, 4 and 12 weeks after treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: TCM examination (tongue, voice and pulse examination), as assessed by photograph, sound recorder and a pulse diagnostic device
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline, 4 and 12 weeks after treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: neck and waist circumference, body weight and height
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline, 4 and 12 weeks after treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Quality of life, as assessed by the 36-Item short-form healthy survey (SF-36), and answered by patients.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline, 4 and 12 weeks after treatment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: status sleepiness, as assessed by the Epworth Sleepiness Scale (ESS), and answered by participants
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline, 4 and 12 weeks after treatment

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: patients with obstructive sleep apnea syndrome which is diagnosed by polysomngraphy
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1. patients who refuse to receive treatment of CPAP 2. patients who have some situation that CPAP is not the first choice and other treatment is suggested (eg. surgical intervention for tonsil enlargement). 3. patients who has underlying diseases of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, myocardial infarction, heart failure, stroke, liver diseases, kidney diseases, neurogic and muscular disorders, metabolic diseases, immunosuppressed diseases, and malignancy

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Obstructive sleep apnea syndrome (OSAS) is composed of sleeping apnea and hypopnea. It also accompanied with fatigue, daytime sleepiness and poor concentration and memory in such patients. The standard treatment for it is usage of continuous positive airway pressure during sleeping. In this study, we want to know condition of Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) constitution in patients with OSAS, and to see if treatment of CPAP improves patients' TCM constitution.
